Fall 2020 classes offered to adults through the Community Education division of Silver Creek Central School District are canceled until further notice. The district is unable to host the offerings in the safe and socially distant manner necessary due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The district looks forward to again offering these opportunities to the community as soon as possible, hopefully in winter/spring 2021.

Check out the “Community” tab on our website www.silvercreekschools.org, our Facebook page, the Dunkirk Observer, the Pennysaver, and forthcoming issues of The Silverliner for updates.

Please note: The decision to cancel was made Aug. 24, 2020, after the public forums on re-opening were held and the September 2020 issue of The Silverliner newsletter was published. Please disregard those pages and thank you for your understanding.

SCCS SENIOR JOINS NTHS
Silver Creek High senior CASIMER KOWAL joins 157 students from 27 Western New York high schools inducted into Erie 1 BOCES’ chapter of the National Technical Honor Society (NTHS). Way to go, Casimer! 👏💛🖤💪

Casimer is enrolled in the Electrical Systems program at Erie 1 BOCES. In order to qualify for acceptance into NTHS, a student must be nominated by his or her teacher, have a 90 percent or higher average in their Career and Technical Education course, and maintain an overall grade point average of 85. Students must demonstrate skill development and leadership and hone their responsibility and good character. 👨‍🎓🏫

March 24 ·

The 2020 Pi Day Celebration at Silver Creek Elementary School held recently (Friday, March 13, 2020) was a hit! Pi Day is an annual celebration of the mathematical constant π (pi) and is observed March 14th or 3/14. since 3, 1, and 4 are the first three digits of pi.

Students in Pre-Kindergarten through fifth grade had the opportunity to buy one to three pies for $1 each to throw at SCES staff volunteers! All proceeds will be used for a future Elementary Math Night! Students threw a total of 562 whipped-cream pies!

Thank you to all the staff who helped make the fun experience possible for our kids and to this year’s volunteers: Mrs. Giampaolo, Mrs. Zbytek, Mrs. Near, Miss Bromsted, Deputy Johnson, Mrs. Austin, Mrs. Gould, Miss Sanford, Mrs. Anderson, Mrs. Sills, Miss D’Amaro, Mrs. Johnson, Mrs. Chesbro, and Miss Conner.
